results.title: Thru the mirror
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: Mickey Mouse falls asleep reading Lewis Carroll’s ‘Alice Through the Looking Glass’ and dreams himself into wonderland. Features Mickey in 1930’s dance routine. Notable for virtuoso Disney animation techniques, anticipating the design and devices used in the later feature version of Alice in Wonderland.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Educational Media Company

results.title: The Band concert
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Despite interference from a bee, a noisy Donald Duck playing “Turkey in the Straw”, and a full scale whirlwind, Mickey’s band doggedly performs the “William Tell Overture”. This was the first Mickey Mouse cartoon to use technicolor and is considered to be one of the Disney studios best.

results.title: Steamboat Willie
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Steamboat Willie is the first animated film to use synchronised sound, and the first Mickey Mouse cartoon ever released. Mickey appears as a crew member on a riverboat which is captained by big bad Pete. Minnie Mouse is the passenger who joins Mickey as he uses various props as musical instruments. Animation by Ub Iwerks.

results.title: And we're going. 4. To Toledo = I ya vamos. 4. A Toledo
results.creator_credit: Holt, Rinehart and Winston and Joshua Tree Productions
results.brief_description: A Spanish language film. Provides some cultural background of Spain and points out to the students the difference between Spanish spoken by Spanish Americans and Spanish spoken in Spain.

results.title: To Chapultepec = A Chapultepec
results.brief_description: This film provides some cultural background to Mexico, especially Chapultepec to students learning elementary Spanish with the text “Entender Y Hablar”. This is a spanish language film that includes new words which describe what four young people do in the city for fun. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: The Case of the missing chickows: adding positive and negati
results.brief_description: Presents the mysterious didappearance of curious creatures called chickcows to introduce students to pairing as a procedure for adding positive and negative integers. Story by E.D. Bogas and Mitch Rose. Animation by Mitch Rose. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: The Persistent gum
results.brief_description: Short film on eucalypt strategies for coping with environmental stress, mainly fire. Useful introduction to this topic, which is an imnportant factor in forest ecology. Some terms may need to be explained prior to showing. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
